byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt reported from Ankara and Tim Arango from Istanbul. Ceylan Yeginsu contributed reporting from Istanbul.
byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and TIM ARANGO

abstract: United States Marine Corps Gen Joseph F Dunford Jr, chairman of Joint Chiefs of Staff, meets with Turkish officials in Ankara two weeks after attempted coup; says he heard no suggestion US played role in botched conspiracy to topple government.

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: When a top American general met with officials in the Turkish capital he heard no suggestion that the United States had played a role in the failed coup attempt.
snippet: When a top American general met with officials in the Turkish capital he heard no suggestion that the United States had played a role in the failed coup attempt....

headline.main: In an Effort to Maintain U.S. Ties, Turkey Softens Its Tone
headline.print_headline: In a Bid to Maintain Ties, Turkey Changes Its Tone
